summary:
DVDs are digital discs used to store various types of data, such as videos, software, and computer files. Invented in 1995, they offer more storage space than CDs while maintaining the same size. A single-layer DVD can hold up to 4.7 GB, and dual-layer discs can store up to 8.5 GB.

There are different types of DVDs: prerecorded (read-only), recordable (write once), and rewritable. DVDs are commonly used for watching movies on DVD players, and in formats like AVCHD for high-definition videos. They are also used for storing audio and data.
title: DVD
